properties.verseOrder: v1 c1 v2 c2 v3 c3 v4 c4 c5

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: A cup, a cup, My kingdom for a cup. Two lords a goin' to the field. Without protection had to yield. Lord Taran offered his cup; The first lord picked it up. He went away to try it on, To his dismay the size was wrong.

verse.name: c1
v2
verse.lines: A cup, a cup, My kingdom for a cup. The feast was ready to be served; Without the bowl that it deserved. Lord Taran offered his cup; A lady picked it up. A ladle full she did put in, And then the floor did meet her chin.

verse.name: c2
verse.lines: It's so big; It's so incredibly big. Can't believe my eyes, A magnificent size! I'll never fill it up. There's not enough soup at the feast, Or the village!

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: A cup, a cup, My kingdom for a cup. A toast the King did wish to make. Without a goblet hard to fake. Lord Taran offered his cup; The King he picked it up. Discreetly poured his drink inside, And then looked like he nearly died.

verse.name: c3
verse.lines: It's so big, It's so incredibly big. Can't believe my eyes, A magnificent size! I'll never fill it up. Whatta' you think I am? I only brought one bottle!

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: A cup, a cup, My kingdom for a cup. Lord Taran was all suited up. The one thing missing was his cup. A page he found the cup; Lord Taran picked it up. He went inside to put it on; And every lady's eye was drawn.

verse.name: c4
verse.lines: It's so big, It's so incredibly big. Can't believe my eyes, A magnificent size! I hope he fills it up; He better fill it up... He's got a legend to live up to now.

verse.name: c5
verse.lines: It's so big; It's so incredibly big. Can't believe my eyes, A magnificent size! I hope he fills it up. I hope...he fills...it up.
